subject: Re: How to change dynamically (runtime) the classpath for a given test
msgSnippet: Lasse, Thanks for your reply, but you are assuming to much, because you have to modify the classpath by hand. For example under eclipse the current folder (.)
messageBody:
Lasse,

Thanks for your reply, but you are assuming to much, because you
have to modify the classpath by hand. For example under eclipse the
current folder (.) is not on the classpath, so you have addapt the
test to the IDE configuration. I know this can be done very easy
using Ant, but I don't want to impose to use such tools for this
particular example.

Thanks any way,

David

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi David,
>
> On 9/19/07, David <achepati67@...> wrote:
> > I have a method that find a file on classpath and I want to
test it,
> > without assuming a particular classpath.
>
> What I usually do is simply add the file to my "test" source tree,
> effectively putting it in the class path.
>
> Lasse
